content.full_text:
Resolution Introduced in Illinois Legislature to Permit Citizens to Use the Hall of
               Representatives, [21 February 1839]1
paragraphs:
Resolution Introduced in Illinois Legislature to Permit Citizens to Use the Hall of
               Representatives, [21 February 1839]1

footnotes.text:
1A version written inAbraham Lincoln’s handwriting is not extant.On February 21, 1839, Lincoln introduced the resolution in theHouse of Representatives, and the House adopted it the same day.Illinois HouseJournal.  1838. 11th G. A., 1st sess., 
                     476.

2“Any public amusement” most likely was associated with the commemoration and celebration
                  ofGeorge Washington’s birthday.
